overview: The purpose and intent of this measure is to strengthen state fireworks laws by amending various definitions, increasing penalties for fireworks offenses, and establishing various criminal offenses (HB1483_SD1_SSCR1831_). The measure also establishes processes relating to the adjudication of fireworks infractions (HB1483_SD1_SSCR1831_). A key component of the measure is that it now appropriates moneys (HB1483_SD1_SSCR1831_).
appropriations: As the measure has moved through the legislative process, it has been amended to appropriate funds. The Committee on Ways and Means reports that the measure now appropriates moneys, although the specific amount is not detailed in the report (HB1483_SD1_SSCR1831_).
agency_impact: The measure has received broad support from multiple government agencies as it has progressed. Your Committee received written comments in support of this measure from the Department of the Attorney General; Honolulu Police Department; Hawaii County Police Department; and the Department of the Prosecuting Attorney, County of Maui (HB1483_SD1_SSCR1831_). This indicates a consensus among key law enforcement and legal departments on the necessity and structure of the proposed changes.
policy_impact: The Committee on Ways and Means finds that the bill's policy is sound and necessary to reform the State's enforcement approach. Your Committee believes that this measure appropriately addresses shortcomings in the current regulatory framework (HB1483_SD1_SSCR1831_). The committee also affirms that the bill establishes a sensible penalty structure that imposes just consequences based on the severity of violations (HB1483_SD1_SSCR1831_).
updates_from_previous_fiscal_note: This fiscal note reflects changes as the bill passed through the Committee on Ways and Means. The appropriations section is now updated, as the measure now appropriates moneys (HB1483_SD1_SSCR1831_). The agency impact has been updated to reflect broad written support from multiple county police departments and prosecuting attorneys, indicating widespread agency accord.
